newsitem.title: GERMANY: SOCCER-KARLSRUHE CLAIM LAST UEFA CUP PLACE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-KARLSRUHE CLAIM LAST UEFA CUP PLACE.

text.p: Karlsruhe claimed a place in next season's UEFA Cup thanks to a 1-1 draw with relegated Freiburg on the final day of the Bundesliga season.
The draw allowed Karlsruhe to jump into sixth place ahead of 1860 Munich who went down 3-0 away to Werder Bremen.

International wing-back Michael Tarnat, playing his last game for Karlsruhe before his move to champions Bayern Munich, gave his side the lead with a 15th minute header. Nikola Jurcevic equalised for Freiburg before the interval.
1860 were punished for some slack defending against Bremen, who led through Austrian international Andreas Herzog before substitute Bernd Hobsch added a double.
"Of course, we're disappointed we didn't make sixth place," 1860 coach Werner Lorant said. "But if you concede three goals like those, then you've only got yourself to blame."
The Munich side must now hope that VfB Stuttgart, who finished the season in fourth place, beat regional league side Energie Cottbus in the German Cup final in two weeks.
A victory for Stuttgart would send them into the European Cup Winners' Cup, freeing up their UEFA Cup place for 1860.
The battle for sixth place was the only major issue left to be resolved on the final day of the season.
Bayern, who sealed the league title by beating Stuttgart last weekend, were unable to crown their season with a win. They had to be content with a 2-2 draw with Borussia Moenchengladbach.

Juergen Klinsmann put Bayern ahead in his last game for the club before joining Italy's Sampdoria. Moenchengladbach struck back through Stefan Passlack and Karlheinz Pflipsen before Christian Nerlinger salvaged a point for the champions.
